notes: ACR TI-RADS uses a 5-category point-based system from the 2017 ACR TI-RADS White Paper
Points are summed from 5 ultrasound feature categories: Composition, Echogenicity, Shape, Margin, Echogenic Foci
TR1 (0 pts) = Benign, TR2 (1-2 pts) = Not Suspicious, TR3 (3 pts) = Mildly Suspicious, TR4 (4-6 pts) = Moderately Suspicious, TR5 (>=7 pts) = Highly Suspicious
FNA thresholds are size-dependent and category-specific: TR3 >=2.5cm, TR4 >=1.5cm, TR5 >=1.0cm
Spongiform composition is highly specific for benignity (virtually 0% malignancy risk)
Echogenic foci are scored as highest value present, not additive
Punctate echogenic foci (microcalcifications) are associated with papillary thyroid carcinoma
Extrathyroidal extension indicates locally advanced disease (T3/T4)
Taller-than-wide shape indicates growth across tissue planes, a suspicious feature
Very hypoechoic = darker than anterior strap muscles, highly suspicious
Score of 1 is an edge case mapped to TR2 in implementation
Clinical notes are generated for specific high-risk features to aid interpretation
